column4: Umm.. I just installed kubuntu-desktop at my computer yesterday, does it mean i have to go to #kubuntu?
I still have ubuntu, but with kde.
and is something else using your sound card?
mmap.. hmm what does that mean..
In computing, mmap is a POSIX-compliant Unix system call that maps files or devices into memory. It is a kind of memory-mapped I/O.
I think something is using your sound card
is there a way to check if something uses my sound card?
not to my knowledge.. but thats not very much heh
I would check firefox or such
in the future, man cp would have told you
